alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 9:43AM MDT until August 17 at 1:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The McBride burn scar in... South Central Lincoln County in central New Mexico... * Until 145 PM MDT. * At 943 AM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the McBride Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Additionally, the Lincoln County Emergency Manager reports that officials are closing Gavilan Canyon Road. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Gavilan Canyon Road, Blue Lake Drive, Eagle Creek Canyon Road and areas downstream to the Rio Ruidoso. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the McBride Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the McBride Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ruidoso, Ruidoso Downs and Hollywood. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the McBride fire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
